channel.title: Errors
channel.description:
Yesterday, I previewed a post which resulted in an error message as follows:
Sorry, An Error Has Occured! You cannot post new topics in this board.
Next, I used the Quick Reply section to post but when I attempted posting the post, the same error message appeared on the screen.
I logged out and attempted logging in again to no avail as a message as follows appeared on the screen:
You must put in your username.
Of course, I had put in my username.
These errors were taking place in Google Chrome but when I switched to Mozilla Firefox and attempted all of these things, I found that they worked without any errors. When I switched back to Google Chrome after I switched to Mozilla Firefox, I found that everything was back to normal.
What was the problem here which prevented me previewing, posting and logging in?

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Possibly Chrome+some spyware causes this problem? Is it a problem anywhere else besides chrome? If not, it has to be a big problem on other sites too which use cookies.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:306091”]FWIW, I’ve used Chrome as my sole browser (and Chromium on my linux machine) for months now, and never had the problem they describe. If it’s browser dependant, something else affects it as well.[/quote]This, i’ve been using Chrome exlusively since release now.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

FWIW, I’ve used Chrome as my sole browser (and Chromium on my linux machine) for months now, and never had the problem they describe. If it’s browser dependant, something else affects it as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I’ve had this happen to me once, and to a friend of mine. All we had to do was open a new chrome tab and the problem was fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

I have never had any problems like those described in the OP, and i am using Chrome.

Moparisthebest:

You probably shouldn’t use a browser in beta.

http://gigaom.com/2008/12/11/google-chrome-out-of-beta-will-that-be-enough/

Maybe I dont get any errors because i’m in the dev channel, so if you are in the normal one or in the beta, it may help to switch over to the dev channel

you can download the google chrome channel changer here: http://chromium.googlecode.com/files/chromechannel-2.0.exe

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

So, in confirmation, will deleting my cookies fix these errors in the future?

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So these problems only happen with chrome? You probably shouldn’t use a browser in beta. Just a shot in the dark here, but since they “run each tab in a sandbox”, perhaps the cookies aren’t getting synced across different tabs immediately or something, it would be somewhat of a tricky synchronization to pull off correctly on multiple machines.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:7, topic:306091”][quote author=the bank link=topic=402279.msg2981731#msg2981731 date=1254658140]

I have this error quite frequently. I have to delete my cookies to fix it.
[/quote]Is it with chrome as well?

Yes it is.[/quote]Might be something to do with how chrome handles cookies. If switching to firefox works than it just adds more evidence to that claim, as chrome and firefox have separate cookie tables.

Read full topic
